document.masterDocTitle: A revision of the subgenus Bessobates of the genus Netelia from Japan (Hymenoptera, Ichneumonidae, Tryphoninae)

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 110–114. Male of
Netelia ( Bessobates ) yamatoensis
. 110, Head in dorsal view; 111, head in frontal view; 112, mesosoma in dorsal view; 113, fore wing; 114, hind wing.

FIGURES 115–120. Male subgenital plate and genitalia of
Netelia ( Bessobates )
spp. 115–117,
Netelia ( Bessobates ) yakushimensis
; 118–120,
N . ( B .) yamatoensis
; 115, 118, subgenital plate; 116, 119, paramere in mesal view; 117, 120, aedeagus in lateral view.

subSubSection.paragraph: Fore tibial spur 0.4 times as long as 1 st tarsomere, which is 10.2–10.8 times as long as wide; fore tarsal claw with 23–30 pectines; hind tarsal claw with 16–20 pectines.

Head yellow; occiput brownish-yellow; antenna reddish-brown. Mesosoma yellow; mesoscutum with light brown stripes on each of median and lateral lobes; scutellum, postscutellum and propodeum light brown; mesosternum and markings on mesopleuron brownish-yellow. Legs brownish-yellow; hind tarsus whitish-yellow. Wings hyaline; vein C and pterostigma of fore wing brownish-yellow, other veins blackish-brown. Metasoma light brown.
